definition: to blurt out without thinking (idiom)
powerful/vigorous/pungent/towards/in view of
thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: Catching Mom's hand in hand, I blurted out how sorry I was for that night.
sentences.chinese: 抓住妈妈的手，我冲口而出因为那晚，我是多么后悔。

sentences.english: He almost answered his own question, didn't he?
sentences.chinese: 他冲口而出，几乎为自己提供了答案。

sentences.english: I don't blame you for blurting it out.
sentences.chinese: 你那样冲口而出，我不怪你。

definition: to blurt out
to blurt out/to let slip (an indiscreet remark)
shut up/shut your mouth/stop talking
agape and tongue-tied (idiom); at a loss for words/gaping and speechless
(of speech) indistinct/mumbling/hesitating
see 惱羞成怒|恼羞成怒[nao3 xiu1 cheng2 nu4]
to be at a loss for words/speechless
trill (of voice)/see also 顫聲|颤声[zhan4 sheng1]
trembling voice/see also 顫聲|颤声[chan4 sheng1]
to stammer/to mumble/to speak haltingly
slip of the tongue/indiscretion/to blurt out a secret
to obstruct/to stop up
resentful/humiliated and angry
to rebuke/to reprimand
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
to be on the verge of saying what is on one's mind
to suppress (a sob, harsh words etc)
